senses.de: To get used to something, make familiar with
senses.ex: He is trying to accustom to the new environment.

Tips.title: Process Takes Time
Tips.description: Adapting to something new is generally a gradual process, not instant.
Tips.example: You'll slowly accustom to the local dialect.

Tips.title: Emotional Adjustment
Tips.description: The phrase can imply emotional or psychological adaptation to new situations.
Tips.example: It was hard to accustom to life without her.

Tips.title: Different Contexts
Tips.description: 'Accustom to' can be used in various contexts, like social norms, climates, or work routines.
Tips.example: She had to accustom to waking up early for her new job.

senses.de: To train or habituate in behaviors or practices
senses.ex: The dog needed to be accustomed to his new home.

Tips.title: Beyond Environment
Tips.description: Can refer to getting used to not only places but also habits, rules, or routines.
Tips.example: He had to accustom to the college's strict schedule.

Tips.title: Behavioral Change
Tips.description: Often means adopting new behaviors or modifying existing ones.
Tips.example: The players needed to accustom to the coach’s new tactics.

Tips.title: Repeated Exposure
Tips.description: Involves frequent and consistent exposure to what you are adjusting to.
Tips.example: She accustoms to cold water by swimming daily.
